alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 16 at 3:01AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and west central Arkansas, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Crawford. In west central Arkansas, Franklin and Sebastian. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a band of heavy rain producing thunderstorms approaching the Fort Smith and surrounding areas. Portions of this area were hit with very heavy rain yesterday evening, where up to 5 inches has been estimated by radar southeast of Fort Smith. As a result, minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Charleston... Greenwood... Barling... Lavaca... Hackett... Huntington... Bonanza... Branch... Midland... Bloomer... Burnville... Jenny Lind... Fort Chaffee... Washburn... Excelsior... Fort Smith Regional Airport... Kibler... Central City... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
